title: The Best Way To Get Your Kids To Eat Their Vegetables
summary: Kids associate vegetables with being told to do something and not having the freedom to choose when or how much to eat them. This causes them to resent eating them, which makes them not want to eat. Kids also dislike vegetables because they arenâ€™t prepared in ways that are enjoyable for them. Add Spirulina and Chlorella are two types of algae that are rich in minerals, vitamins and many other nutrients that your body needs. Add fruit to the top of your green smoothie, it will bleed into the green colour. If you want your smoothie to look green, add the greens to the bottom of the blender.

In fact, they are born loving them. It\u2019s only after years of hearing \u201Ceat your veggies\u201D that they start to resent eating them. This happens for a few reasons. Kids associate vegetables with being told to do something and not having the freedom to choose when or how much to eat them. This causes them to resent eating them, which makes them not want to eat them.
Kids also dislike vegetables because they aren\u2019t prepared in ways that are enjoyable for them. You can\u2019t just feed them raw broccoli and expect them to love it. They need to be presented in a way that gets them excited about eating them. This means finding ways to prepare vegetables that are both tasty and enjoyable for them to eat.`),mdx("h2",null,"How to Make a Green Smoothie for Your Kid"),mdx("p",null,"Once you\u2019ve chosen which ingredients you want to put into your green smoothie, the next step is to blend them up. If you have a blender with a large capacity, use it, but keep in mind that you may need to chop up some of your ingredients if they\u2019re too big. If you have a smaller blender, use a food processor or hand blender."),mdx("p",null,"Once your smoothie is blended, pour it into a bowl and add in any toppings you want like crumbled cookies, granola, nuts, seeds, dried fruit or coconut flakes. This will give your smoothie a fun appearance that kids will want to eat."),mdx("h2",null,"Add Spirulina and Chlorella"),mdx("p",null,"Spirulina and chlorella are two types of algae that are rich in minerals, vitamins and many other nutrients that your body needs. These algae also contain protein, which makes them a great addition to a green smoothie that kids will want to drink."),mdx("p",null,"If a smoothie isn\u2019t appealing to your child, adding a scoop of spirulina or chlorella powder to their favourite food is another way to add this veggie boost to their diet. You can add it to oatmeal, yogurt, smoothies, pancakes, muffins, cookies and more."),mdx("h2",null,"Add Fruit"),mdx("p",null,"Fruits like berries, apples, oranges, mangoes and bananas are loaded with vitamins, minerals and antioxidants. These delicious fruits are the perfect way to get your kids excited about eating their vegetables."),mdx("p",null,"If you add fruit to the top of your green smoothie, it will bleed into the green colour. This turns your smoothie into a purple smoothie that kids may not want to drink. If you\u2019re adding fruit to the bottom of your smoothie, your drink will be green. If you\u2019re adding fruit to the top of your smoothie, make sure to blend it until it\u2019s liquefied so it doesn\u2019t leave chunks at the top of the glass."),mdx("h2",null,"Add Dark Leafy Greens"),mdx("p",null,"Kale, spinach, Swiss chard and other dark leafy greens are packed with vitamins, minerals and antioxidants. These are the perfect ingredients to add to a green smoothie that will help kids get all the nutrients they need without even knowing it."),mdx("p",null,"If you choose to add these greens to the top of your smoothie, make sure to blend them until they\u2019re liquefied so there are no chunks left behind. If you want your smoothie to look green, add the greens to the bottom of the blender so they don\u2019t get blended up."),mdx("h2",null,"Adding Hidden Veggies: Broccoli, Spinach, Beets and more."),mdx("p",null,"If you want to give your kids a nutritious boost but don\u2019t want them to know they\u2019re drinking their veggies, here are some good ingredients to add to your green smoothie: broccoli, spinach, radishes, beets, carrots and bell peppers."),mdx("p",null,"These veggies blend up well in a green smoothie and you won\u2019t be able to taste them. If you\u2019re adding them to the top of your smoothie, make sure to blend them until they\u2019re liquefied and they don\u2019t leave behind any chunks. If you want your smoothie to look green, add these ingredients to the bottom of the blender."),mdx("h2",null,"Conclusion"),mdx("p",null,"Creating the perfect green smoothie for your kid isn\u2019t difficult if you know what to put in it. The trick is to put nutritious ingredients into a drink that kids will love. This will get them excited about drinking their veggies, which will help them get the nutrients they need."),mdx("p",null,"Kids these days want sugar and flavour in everything they eat. If you can find a way to sneak nutrients into their favourite drinks and foods, you\u2019ll be doing them a favour and helping them grow up to be healthy adults."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

How to Eat Healthy on a Budget

For some it might be a small splurge, for others, a luxury they can\u2019t afford. Either way, eating healthy on a budget isn\u2019t easy. Eating less processed and pre-packaged foods is one way to cut costs and stay healthy at the same time. Another way is to get creative and buy things when they are on special or use cheaper alternatives like frozen or canned versions of fruits and veggies instead of the fresh ones. There are many ways to do this that won\u2019t leave you feeling deprived while still giving your body what it needs to be healthy.
For those who eat a lot of fast food or find themselves eating unhealthy because it\u2019s cheaper than buying wholesome foods, these tips will help you make healthier choices while saving money at the same time.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

We\u2019ve all experienced some level of anxiety from time to time \u2014 it can be perfectly normal. However, for some people, anxiety can become debilitating and start to have a negative impact on their everyday life. If you experience social anxiety or general anxiety more often than not, read on to discover how to deal with it effectively.
If you struggle with anxiety frequently and strongly, you are certainly not alone. In fact, almost 20% of adults in the United States experience some form of anxiety or another on a regular basis. Although there is no magical cure for dealing with anxiety permanently, there are many things that you can do to manage your symptoms better and live a happier life as a result.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: Exercising Your Way to a Fitter You: Walk or Run - Which Is Best for You?

But those little things are what make all the difference in the end. Take morning routines, for example. They may not seem like much on their own, but they have the power to make or break your day from start to finish.
With so many different morning routines out there, it can be difficult to know which one is right for you. There are those that are super long and involved, and others that are much shorter and simpler. relatedArticles.title: How to Make Healthy Eating a Part of Your Weight Loss Plan

This may seem obvious, but you might be surprised at how many people struggle to keep weight loss goals focused on healthy eating. It\u2019s not just about cutting calories; it\u2019s about making sure those calories come from nutritious whole foods that boost your metabolism and maintain energy levels.
Even with the constant bombardment of pro-fad diet messages in the media, most people understand that cutting calories alone is not an effective weight loss strategy. In fact, research shows that for lasting weight loss, dieters need to adopt healthy habits that they can sustain for life\u2014like eating more fruits and vegetables, whole grains, lean protein sources, and other low-fat or non-fat sources of nutrients. But even setting this as our goal doesn\u2019t guarantee we\u2019ll achieve it. Here are some tips to help you put healthy eating at the center of your weight loss plan so you get results you can keep forever:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Make Your Kitchen a Healthier Place

Whether in a home, restaurant, cafeteria or any other eatery, almost all food establishments serve high-calorie, high-sugar and high-fat meals that are laden with salt and unhealthy oils.What is unfortunate about this situation is that many people have no choice but to eat this way on a regular basis. If you work in an office, it\u2019s highly likely that your building has its own kitchen where a catered lunch service prepares hot lunches for staff every day. Similarly, if you go to school, there will most likely be a canteen serving the same type of unhealthy food as an adult educational institution.The good news is that even if you are stuck eating these foods on a daily basis, you can make your kitchen a healthier place by altering what goes into the meals you cook at home and the ones that you buy. Here are some tips on how you can do just that:"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 10 Ways to Get Moving When You Don't Feel like It

Many of us make the common resolution to exercise more. However, that can be easier said than done for some people. If you don\u2019t feel like working out one day, it doesn\u2019t mean you stop going to the gym or just give up entirely. It means you have to come up with creative ways to stay motivated and get moving when you don\u2019t feel like it.
Exercising is not always fun, but we need it to remain healthy and fit. While some people love sweating in their favorite gym class, others avoid workouts because they know how much they hate them. While exercise can be difficult at times, there are lots of different ways you can make moving more fun so that it becomes second nature and something you no longer dread.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

The Best Healthy Snacks to Keep You Going

You probably spend the first few hours of it at your desk, sipping on a cup of coffee, reading emails, and maybe even taking a brief walk around the office to stretch your legs. Then you head back to your desk, only to dive into an afternoon filled with more reading and typing\u2014no time for walking again. And by 5pm you\u2019re ready to call it a day and head home. However, in that short span of time, you need to find some way to keep going through all those tasks. What do you do?
The answer is simple: Healthy snacks! Think about how much time you spend away from home throughout the day \u2013 whether it\u2019s at work or school, there are plenty of opportunities for snacking. In fact, keeping healthy snacks around can help boost your energy when you need it most. Check out these top-rated healthy snacks that will keep you going all day long\u2026`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
